intro: Pouzolzia macrura, commonly known as the long-stalked pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Pouzolzia macrura is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
